discussion:
FXUS65 KBOI 092147
AFDBOI

Area Forecast Discussion
National Weather Service Boise ID
247 PM MST Tue Jan 9 2024

.SHORT TERM...Tonight through Thursday night...A strong upper
low is fueling development of showers and a few thunderstorms
this afternoon. Flow aloft is supplying a W to E storm motion
of 50kt and showers/storms have produced widespread gusts of 45
to 55 mph with locally higher gusts mostly across higher
terrain. Winds and showers will diminish this evening, then ramp
up again Wednesday morning as another upper trough pushes into
the region. Similar to this morning, the contour of heavier
snowfall will follow the terrain. Areas near the foothills into
the mountains see the best chance for accumulating snow. In the
Snake Plain this will favor areas north/east of I84. Winds will
again ramp up across SE oregon and higher terrain of SW Idaho
early Wednesday with widespread gusts 45 to 55 mph. Coupled with
the snowfall this will make for dangerous winter driving
conditions through late morning. In the Western Magic Valley the
worst conditions still look to be limited to the northern
foothills north of Jerome/Gooding heading into the Camas
Prairie. Precipitation tapers off Wednesday afternoon and winds
will relax some as the upper wave exits. Showers will continue
in the mountains but snowfall rates drop off after late morning.
Given this timing have shortened ending timing on the current
suite of hazards. Northwest flow will keep a chance of showers
in the mountains into Thursday while valleys catch a short break.
The next upper wave drops into the Pac NW on Thursday, bringing
another round of widespread snow to the mountains and increasing
the chance of snow in the valleys. Amounts are looking similar
to recent storms and gusty winds will again accompany this
storm.

.LONG TERM...Friday through Tuesday...Heavy snow and strong
winds expected Friday through Saturday night. Strong northwest
flow will not only support strong gusts Friday
morning/afternoon, but also begin a significant moisture flow
that`ll support snowfall through Saturday. The northerly
component and a colder airmass will keep snowlevels around 1-2
kft MSL. Precipitation may not be widespread at first, as weaker
dynamics keep the snow over terrain, but a Pacific low moves
inland Saturday afternoon with more moisture and favorable
forcing. Models differ on the track of this system which hints
that the timing and snowfall amounts are still uncertain.
However, snow accumulation is expected in all areas. NBM
forecast totals are currently 3-7 inches in SE Oregon, 4-10
inches in the Snake Plain, generally varying with elevation, and
10-20 inches in mountain valleys with more on the summits. As a
ridge begins to move in following the Pacific low, the chance
for mixed precip in the valley increases in the evening
Saturday. Although, models are generally trending colder, so
that chance may decrease. Going into Sunday the ridge builds
through the period. We will stay cold under northerly flow, but
much drier. A brief period of stagnant air is possible.

&&

.AVIATION...Scattered MVFR and local IFR conditions inside
showers, otherwise VFR mostly cloudy. Rain & mixed precipitation
in elevations below 4

weather: Heavy Snow and Areas Blowing Snow then Snow Likely
text: Snow.  Areas of blowing snow. High near 28. Breezy, with a west wind around 25 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph.  Chance of precipitation is 90%. Total daytime snow accumulation of 3 to 7 inches possible.

Snow.  Areas of blowing snow before 11pm. Low around 16. Wind chill values between zero and 5. Breezy, with a west wind 16 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph.  Chance of precipitation is 90%. New snow accumulation of 5 to 9 inches possible.

Snow. The snow could be heavy at times.  Areas of blowing snow before 11am. High near 17. Wind chill values between -3 and 2. Breezy, with a west wind 17 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 43 mph.  Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 4 to 8 inches possible.
A 50 percent chance of snow.  Mostly cloudy, with a low around 12. Wind chill values between -1 and 4. West northwest wind 9 to 15 mph.  New snow accumulation of 2 to 4 inches possible.
Snow likely, mainly after 11am.  Mostly cloudy, with a high near 18. West wind 8 to 14 mph.  Chance of precipitation is 70%. New snow accumulation of 3 to 5 inches possible.
Snow.  Areas of blowing snow. Low around 18. Breezy.  Chance of precipitation is 90%. New snow accumulation of 5 to 9 inches possible.
Snow. The snow could be heavy at times.  High near 23. Breezy.  Chance of precipitation is 80%. New snow accumulation of 6 to 10 inches possible.
Snow likely. The snow could be heavy at times.  Mostly cloudy, with a low around 18. Chance of precipitation is 70%.
Snow. The snow could be heavy at times.  High near 23. Chance of precipitation is 80%.
Snow.  Low around 14. Chance of precipitation is 80%.
A 40 percent chance of snow.  Partly sunny, with a high near 18.
A 20 percent chance of snow.  Partly cloudy, with a low around 6.
A 20 percent chance of snow.  Mostly sunny, with a high near 16.
A 30 percent chance of snow.  Mostly cloudy, with a low around 8.
A chance of snow.  Partly sunny, with a high near 19.
